body:
Is this a verified bug? I am currently postponing installing macOS 10.14 because of this thread.

If this is still an unresolved problem, could this be any relevant?
https://github.com/KhronosGroup/MoltenVK/issues/78

Atleast I can verify that on two devices with Mojave installed my Application using GLFW doesn't work anymore because of this message in the error log.

It seems that Mojave does now require a CAMetalLayer just like iOS, instead of just a NSView. 

I suggest you postpone the upgrade until a fix is released. Or try one of those suggested fixes from your link.

issue.body:
Here is a place for figuring out what we need to do for the 3.3 release. As long as 3.3 hasn't been released there is still time to comment.

### Things that will go into 3.3
These are what I (elmindreda) will focus on getting merged before starting on any of the other ones.
- [x] Content scale queries (`glfwGet*ContentScale`) #235, #439 (implicitly), #676, #677, #845, #898
- [x] Joystick axis fixes (XInput y-axis, ~IOHID x-axis~) #1083 
  - very little work
- [x] Full window opacity (`GLFW_OPACITY`) #1089
  - little work
- [x] Lock key query (`glfwGetKeyLock`) #946
  - little work, all platforms
- [x] Gamepad mapping modifiers
  - little work

### Things that could go into 3.3
Most of these are relatively isolated and can be done without much coordination, the one major exception being joystick state callbacks. If you want to take on one of them then please leave a comment below so we can avoid duplicate work. Also, in many cases there is already a work-in-progress branch, some of them already on GitHub. I'll start pushing the remaining ones as soon as I'm able.

If you are waiting for one of these features but would prefer that 3.3 not be delayed for it, please leave a comment. Also, if you have no personal interest in a feature but think it's worth delaying the release for it, please leave a comment and (optionally) explain why.

- ~[ ] Joystick state callbacks (`glfwSetJoystick*Callback`) #601 (half of), #856~
  - some work, all platforms, intersects with event time
- ~[ ] Joystick state query (`glfwGetJoystickState`, `GLFWjoystickstate`) #601 (half of)~
  - little work, shared code only
- ~Event time (`glfwGetEventTime`) #1012~
- ~EGLDevice backend (no API change) #786~
- ~[ ] Disable screensaver via libdbus (no API change) #854~
  - some work, Unix only
- ~Native handle attachment (function name needed) #25~
- ~IME functions (pre-edit event, pre-edit window position, IME toggle) #41, #658~
- [x] macOS window occlusion (design needed) #680 
  - unknown amount of work

There are also many very valuable ways to contribute other than making feature PRs.

I know some of you are very familiar with the internals and conventions of GLFW. You could team up with and mentor someone new to the project who is taking on one of the above features and get the PR from promising to ready to merge.

Documentation bug reports and PRs are always welcome. There has been a lot of documentation added or changed since the last release. There will be mistakes in it, as well as awkward phrasings and poor explanations. The compilation and build guides are especially terrible and could use both improvements, expansion and (especially for the GUI parts) lots of images (default system DPI, default UI theme).

~The Doxygen custom CSS needs to be updated since Doxygen broke tons of the current one in a recent release. Most importantly the colors of the new dynamic menus. This one doesn't have an issue so open one if you're taking this on.~ Done by @siavashserver in #1100 

Is your project using GLFW? Are you still using 3.2.1 or earlier? Try running it on 3.3 and see if everything works. If not, please open an issue ASAP.

Do you have any joysticks or controllers laying around? There have been major changes to the macOS joystick backend, the Linux one has been replaced entirely and the SDL_gamecontrollerdb support needs all the testing it can get.

Since we just added a new parser with `glfwUpdateGamepadMappings`, run fuzzers against it and report or fix any bugs they find.

Meta-contributions: suggest new suggestions for this list.

body:
Cannot reproduce on macOS 10.14.1 with Vulkan SDK 1.1.92.1.

GLFW creates a CAMetalLayer for the view when `glfwCreateWindowSurface` is called and has done so since support for MoltenVK was added. It is possible we are clobbering this layer by accident for some call sequence. Do you have a test program that triggers this?
I haven't tested this with the macOS 10.14.1 update and the current Vulkan SDK. I'll check it and report back.

body:
I tested it today, the issue with the CAMetalLayer seems to be gone with 10.14.2. However we run into another issue:
`VK_ERROR_EXTENSION_NOT_PRESENT`
when calling `glfwCreateWindowSurface`.

I created a small test application for you to test, download link below.
@hecaex Sorry, I won't run targeted binaries. What error description does GLFW provide when the call fails?
A call to `glfwGetError` returns nothing. But a call to `glfwCreateWindowSurface` returns `VK_ERROR_EXTENSION_NOT_PRESENT`.
That is very odd. Are you compiling GLFW with `MAC_OS_X_VERSION_MAX_ALLOWED` set to less than macOS 10.11?

No I compile GLFW statically with macOS 10.14. The weird thing is, that on macOS 10.13 (High Sierra) everything worked (I updated some time ago to Mojave, recompiled alot of times and also used the 'old' binaries I compiled). Maybe I'm doing something totally wrong in my configuration and Mojave needs special configuration. The issue I opened before seem to be gone since 10.14.2. But now the next weird error happens. I could send you some Xcode project I created for testing (without any binaries, so you have to add GLFW, libvulkan.1.dylib and libMoltenVK.dylib from the VulkanSDK into the project root directory.) According to MoltenVK one have to add both libvulkan.dylib and libMoltenVK.dylib + the icd json file to the ressources directory of the app. I did this, but it seem to fail ONLY with Mojave and GLFW.

I uploaded a code only test project: 
[Link](https://oc.cyphis.com/s/hwyUZztY8DXS3Cf)
SHA1: 7199e33323ad55fc9c2b8ea22fd4e296442b42a68ec8eeae683a4b86a30a0d25
[VirusTotal](https://www.virustotal.com/#/file/7199e33323ad55fc9c2b8ea22fd4e296442b42a68ec8eeae683a4b86a30a0d25/detection)

I ran into the same problems using VulkanSDK [1.1.92.1](
https://vulkan.lunarg.com/sdk/home#sdk/downloadConfirm/1.1.92.1/mac/vulkansdk-macos-1.1.92.1.tar.gz) and GLFW [master](
https://github.com/glfw/glfw/commit/cf0857f79aed5688d764d33dda11d3cee031a182).
However I apparently fixed it by adding the following line
`[window->ns.view setLayer:window->ns.layer];`
right before [`cocoa_window.m` : `[window->ns.view setWantsLayer:YES];`](https://github.com/glfw/glfw/blob/c90c7b97109db909577e3bf540b5f884422b7e14/src/cocoa_window.m#L1824).

Without this simple assignment, the layer was of type `_NSViewBackingLayer` as I figured out using
`NSLog(@"yourObject is a: %@", NSStringFromClass([window->ns.layer class]));`.

It seems that the surface ends up with the wrong dimensions this way :(
I was able to fix that by removing (commenting out)
`[window->ns.layer setContentsScale:[window->ns.object backingScaleFactor]];`
which was added for #1229.

Furthermore I have to use VulkanSDK [1.1.73.0](https://vulkan.lunarg.com/sdk/home#sdk/downloadConfirm/1.1.73.0/mac/vulkansdk-macos-1.1.73.0.tar.gz) beacause `vkCreateSwapchainKHR` stopped working. (I did not test any releases between those two mentioned.) Probably doing something terribly wrong, but I have no Idea what

Anyway this works for me and as I know almost nothing about Apple's API I'm happy about that..

PS: The MoltenVK code to check for `CAMetalLayer` can be found [here](https://github.com/KhronosGroup/MoltenVK/blob/5f661ea6d8fa055f0c1d7b8dd0e0ba3c4d73e543/MoltenVK/MoltenVK/GPUObjects/MVKSurface.mm#L42).

Indeed, this fix worked like a charm!
I was able to run my application with the mentioned code change in GLFW.

Also note for loading GLFW dynamically. There is need to load the MoltenVK libs directly if there is no ICD json file. So GLFW should try to load the following files:

`libvulkan.dylib`
`libvulkan.dylib.1`
`libMoltenVK.dylib`
